doc.field: Consumers Power Co said the Federal Energy Regulatory Commission approved the company's Midland cogeneration venture as a "qualifying" facility under the Public Utility Regulatory Policies Act. It said the approval overcomes the last potential federal hurdle to converting Midland to a combined-cycle, natural gas-fired cogeneration plant. In October 1986, the venture received permission from the U.S. Department of Energy to fuel the plant permanently with natural gas. Reuter
